newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian shares plunge with foreign markets.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian shares plunge with foreign markets.

text.p: Norwegian shares fell sharply with foreign markets on Tuesday when trade resumed on a nervous note after the Easter holiday.
The Oslo Bourse Total index, which is highly sensitive to movements on Wall Street, closed 3.15 percent lower at 1,042.70 points.
Turnover was relatively low at 752 million crowns with foreign investors being among the sellers, dealers said.
"There are many cheap shares on offer here for those who dare buying them," a senior analyst said, looking especially at blue chip stock.
Industrial heavyweight Norsk Hydro, Norway's biggest listed company, slipped 4.1 percent to 316.50 crowns. It was the most traded share at 110 million crowns.
Industrial group Kvaerner's A share slumped five percent to 340 crowns.
The analyst said: "We have a moderate outlook and are maintaining our target of 1,100 points for the Total index at yearend. We won't change that just because of worries about interest rates."
